value.title: Singapore touts need for AI transparency in launch of test toolkit
value.excerpt: New pilot framework and toolkit will enable businesses to demonstrate their "objective and verifiable" use of artificial intelligence, says the Singapore government, which hopes to drive transparency in AI deployments through technical and process checks.

value.title: AI Ethics And The Quagmire Of Whether You Have A Legal Right To Know Of AI Inferences About You, Including Those Via AI-Based Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: AI Ethics and whether you ought to have a legal right to know of AI inferences about you, a topic even of concern when it comes to AI-based self-driving cars.

value.excerpt: A bubbling up theory is that AI biases are reflections of hidden societal power dynamics, which has vital impacts for AI and AI Ethics, including the use case of self-driving cars.

value.title: Ethics in the AI, Technology, and Information Age
value.excerpt: Increasingly, technology, the Internet and social media are playing a major part in our lives. What should we think about the ethical issues that arise, such as the changing role of intelligent machines in this Information Age?

value.title: AI Ethics Forewarns Don't Be Caught In Machine Learning Myopia By Overlooking Neuro-Symbolic AI, Including For Autonomous Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: There is a rising controversy about Machine Learning myopia as to overlooking the value of neuro-symbolic AI or hybrid AI, which has crucial ramifications for AI and AI Ethics. This includes the advent of AI-based self-driving cars.
